title: A Phase I, Double Blind, Randomized, Two-Way Cross Over, Single- Centre Study in Healthy CYP2D6 Extensive Metabolizers and Poor Metabolizers to Investigate the Potential of AZD3480 to Inhibit Cytochrome P450 1A2, 2C19, 3A4, 2C8, 2B6 and UGT1A1 Activity
description_brief: The purpose of the study is to evaluate if AZD3480 inhibits Cytochrome P450 1A2, 2C19, 3A4, 2C8, 2B6 and UGT1A1 activity.
explanation_target: Reason: AZD3480 (also named TC-1734, ispronicline) is a selective neuronal nicotinic acetylcholine receptor (α4β2) agonist that was developed to improve cognition (age-associated memory impairment and Alzheimer’s disease) rather than to modify underlying AD pathology. citeturn0search1turn0search3turn0search0
